H0.text: To find mates is why animals most likely have to leave an area during a drought.

H1.text: To find shelter is why animals most likely leave an area during a drought.

H2.text: To escape predators is the most likely reason animals would have to leave an area during a drought.

H3.text: Animals would most likely leave an area during a drought to find water and food.

A4.text: Because of the lack of watering holes, many grazing animals are forced to migrate due to the lack of water in search of more fertile lands.
